Psychology_219_r$Psychology_0_p$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: Support from one\'s partner can help -- but only if the smokers have developed skills of their own that help them to stop.
Finding B: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding C: To conclude, we show here that touch regulates physiological coupling during pain, suggesting that interpersonal coupling is affected by various contextual social cues.
Finding D: The connection between close friendship strength and relative increases in self-worth, in particular, extends to adolescence prior findings by , in which younger children undergoing negative events experienced less of a decrease in self-worth when their best friend was present.

Finding C: To conclude, we show here that touch regulates physiological coupling during pain, suggesting that interpersonal coupling is affected by various contextual social cues.
Finding D: The connection between close friendship strength and relative increases in self-worth, in particular, extends to adolescence prior findings by , in which younger children undergoing negative events experienced less of a decrease in self-worth when their best friend was present.

Finding B: Thus, as expected, consumers in the behaviorally targeted ad condition recognized that the ad implied a social label to a greater extent than those in the other conditions.
Finding C: We found that co-occurring psychopathology is only a partial mediator of the association between PEs and suicidal behavior; that is, PEs are a marker of risk for later suicidal behavior in excess of the risk associated with co-occurring mental disorders.
